records.story: Light beam witnessed above Mission Bay/Pacific Beach San Diego. Beam of light shot down from clouds, potentially above ocean in Mission Bay, near Pacific Beach, San Diego, California. ((NUFORC Note:  Witness elects to remain totally anonymous; provides no contact information.  PD))

records.summary: New Years Amber light formation San Diego.
records.story: New Years Amber light formation San Diego. It was early New Years morning and I fell asleep around 10pm on New Year's Eve I was home alone my wife was working at la Jolla shores bath and tennis club.  She called and woke me up around 01:15 New Years morning and asked to be picked up in 30 minutes.  I walked out of my apartment at 2636 grand avenue in San Diego. I walked down the walkway to my car parked on the north side of the building.  On my way to the car I looked up and noticed several Amber lights moving slowly over the la Jolla hills to the north. I thought it strange, but San Diego being a big military city I figured that it was helicopters or some military aircraft. I got in my jeep with the top down and headed north on the I 5 from pacific beach and noticed the lights again as I approached the la Jolla parkway exit and noticed there were 7 or 8 Amber lights at what seemed like an altitude of about 1000 feet above the hill moving extremely slowly from east to west in a sloppy triangle formation! with the rear light occasionally leapfrogging to the front of the formation. It seemed the lights were slightly ahead of me as I proceeded onto la Jolla parkway towards the north west and when I got to the top of the hill and stopped at the traffic light at the intersection of la Jolla parkway and la Jolla shores drive the lights appeared to stay stationary directly above me at an estimated altitude of 1000-2000 feet.  I did not hear any noise other than traffic whatsoever. At this point I concluded if they were helicopters I would surely be hearing them.  I turned north on la Jolla shores drive and proceeded Approximately 1/2 mile to the bath and tennis club and my wife was waiting curbside and got in the jeep. I turned around to a south heading and told my wife about the lights and pointed them out to her. She thought them strange as well. At that time they seemed about 1/2 mile to the west and picking up steady speed. By the time I got back to the traffic light 1/2 mile! south at la Jolla shores drive and la Jolla parkway the light! s seemed at least 5 miles out to sea already and continuing west/northwest. I turned to head east and lost sight of the lights by the time I reached my apartment again about 4-5 minutes later I could not find the lights again

records.summary: Orange light crossed the sky like a fast satellite and then dropped down at a sharp angle backwards and disappeared.
records.story: Orange light crossed the sky like a fast satellite and then dropped down at a sharp angle backwards and disappeared. Last night my son and I were outside, setting up our telescope.  We watched what seemed to be a satellite cross the sky, moving from the west to the east.  It had a slight orange color, being about as bright as Mars.  Its speed was a little faster than a satellite.   As it moved east, toward the moon, I lost track of it in the glow of the moon.   I expected it to emerge from the glow on the other side-at the same speed but, when it reappeared, it became brighter and like a meteor, it dropped down at a sharp angle back to the west.   Then it completely disappeared.  The distance it dropped was about the length of a finger at arms length.    We didn't see anything afterward. ((NUFORC Note:  We spoke with the witness via telephone, and he seemed to us to be quite sincere, and sober-minded.  In part because of his experience with astronomy, we suspect that the source of the report is a skilled witness.  PD))

records.summary: An orange light moved into the glow of the moon and came back out, brighter, shooting diagonally down.
records.story: An orange light moved into the glow of the moon and came back out, brighter, shooting diagonally down and in a slightly reversed motion. While looking at stars with my dad, we saw what we thought was a satellite crossing the sky, from west to east.  It appeared slightly orange, about the same brightness and color as Mars.  It was travelling at a speed similar to a satellite--but a little faster.  It moved east, getting closer toward the moon, until it was lost in its glow.  It was just above the moon when it disappeared in the glow.  We expected it to emerge from the glow on the other side but, when it came out of the glow, it suddenly got brighter and at about the speed of a meteor, dropped down diagonally, angled backwards to the west (like a backwards "7")  and then suddenly disappeared.  The distance it dropped was about the length of a finger held at arm's length.

records.summary: San Diego, CA 9/19/16 3:32 am  I heard noise like a thunder clap and what sounded to be a low flying roar from an aircraft. I walked ou
records.story: San Diego, CA 9/19/16 3:32 am  I heard noise like a thunder clap and what sounded to be a low flying roar from an aircraft.  I walked out to my patio and saw a black triangle hovering over murphy canyon area just south of   Browns field.  I have seen this craft before and I have no doubt it was a tr-3b.  I filmed one in El Cajon, CA on 12-30-12. It was a black triangle with lights on all 3 points and one larger light ball in the middle.  It hovered for about a minute and went south slowly dissapearing in the haze before it returned from the same direction in a slow zig-zag pattern.  Then I witnessed a brilliant flash and explosion sound.  My camera recorded the flash, but it was not aimed at the craft at the time.  Upon reviewing the film the flash was actually three very quick bursts of extremely bright light. It then dissapeared to the south west towards south park and I lost sight again.  In the distance were 2 or 3 more flashes and there were thunder claps as well, but again. and again, there was briliiant flashes and some more thunder claps.  So I don't know for sure if the flashes and noise were related to the triangular craft I saw, but I know what I saw was a hovering craft.  There possibly was two of them it was hard to tell due to the 50% visibility.

records.summary: My wife and I both saw three orange lights in the sky, moving in different directions, and making no sound.
records.story: My wife and I both saw three orange lights in the sky, moving in different directions, and making no sound. My wife called me out to the back yard and I saw an orange light moving slowly southeast -- towards the rising moon -- without making a sound.   I assumed it was some sort of plane and went back inside, but then she called me back: two more orange lights were moving across the sky, one moving towards us from the northeast, before straightening out and moving straight south, the other in roughly the same region as the first.   There was no sound from any of the three lights.   This was strange enough for me to search for a site like this one!

records.summary: Flashing fireball slowly moving over Mission Valley around 9:36 pm on Monday night 8/15/2016. Looked like the flash of fire wold repeat
records.story: Flashing fireball slowly moving over Mission Valley around 9:36 pm on Monday night 8/15/2016. Looked like the flash of fire wold repeat slowly moving each time the engines fired.  Probably 6-10 times a second leaving a visible separate fire ball trail.  Then it would go black for a few seconds and fire off 6-10 more times.  It lasted for 30-60 seconds.  I was speaking on my cell phone on my apartment balcony with my girlfriend looking out over Mission Valley when I noticed it.  At first I thought it was fireworks but it was moving slowly in a Northeastern direction.  I told my girlfriend who laughed at me and then I told her I needed to hang up the phone to video it.  By the time I hit record the ufo had been gone for maybe 5-0 seconds.  I just missed it.

records.story: Not sure what we saw Thought it was a plane landing looking north from point loma in san diego   Some one said meteor but it was moving too slow.  it had orange streak behind it.  Then it split in two and began to fade  could not get camera out fast enough. fell from sight. ((NUFORC Note:  Space debris.  PD))

records.summary: Triangle Pattern Of Lights Off San Diego Coastline
records.story: Triangle Pattern Of Lights Off San Diego Coastline From the beach in Oceanside, CA, 25 miles north of Mt Soledad (La Jolla), I observed the formation of lights described by "the pilot" in the other report.   I was driving down Pacific Coast Highway, when I noticed the triangle pattern of 3 extremely bright yellow orange lights.  I drove to a beach parking lot adjacent to Wisconsin Street in Oceanside to get a clear view over the ocean of the lights.  Other people there at the beach were observing the lights as well and remarking that they seemed strange.  The lights appeared to be 5  to 10 miles off the San Diego coast over the ocean due West of La Jolla.  The lowest light of the triangle pattern may have been 5,000 to 7,500 feet in altitude.  The 2 upper lights of the triangle formation were not level, and may have been in the 10,000 to 12,500 altitude range.  The triangle was large and the lights were much brighter in intensity than any aircraft landing lights would have been at that distance.  I tried to t! ake a picture with my cel phone camera but the images did not register.  All of us present observed the light pattern for about 10 minutes, then one seemed to turn off.   I drove off, continuing Southward on Pacific Coast Highway towards home, and when I looked about 10 minutes later the lights were gone.  My thought was the lights may have been some type of signal flares and perhaps the Navy was conducting some sort of training or practice exercise off of the San Diego coast.  I have seen signal flares in the night sky at Camp Pendelton and they slowly descend and weaken as they drop.  These lights did not descend and were at least 10x's brighter or more than any signal flare I've seen.  I've done a couple of Google searches and couldn't find any mention or explanation.   When I came across the other report from "the pilot" on Mt Soledad, I realized we had observed the same lights, and decided to file this report.  I do not believe earth has ever been visited by "extraterrestrials", I believe there is a man made explanation of  these lights.

records.summary: I want answers about this n
records.story: I want answers about this n This event happened when I was around 10 years old at boyscout camp.  The event started around 1800hrs to early morning 0300hrs, there where around 150-200 boys, and a number of scout leaders, with me.   We where hiking to a creek where we where going to sleep under the stars on the creek bed.  Soon after we got to the creek, we noticed that there were large rocks being thrown into the creek.  At first, we thought that the rocks where being thrown by some of the other boys.  That was not the case, since one of the boys got hit with a good size rock.  Then we noticed that the rocks where being thrown over 100 foot trees into the creek.  With that, we decided to line up in single file and sweep the wood line.  The wood line was around 60 feet or so thick, on the other side of wood line was a large open field there was no one there.  We where all shocked.   The scoutmasters decided to bed down on the creek bed cause it was too dangerous to go back in the dark, for thee boys got hurt during the sweep of the wood line.  We where instucted to dig into the creek bed, and cover our heads with our hiking back packs to shield us from the rocks, and we went to sleep.   At some point in the night I woke and saw two object with lights, blue, green and yellow, floating off center of each other up and down. the objects where cone shaped top and bottom with three lights in the middle, one on top and one light on the bottom of the objects.  I tried scream to my scoutmaster who was next to me, but I could not speak,  I could not move, then black.  I do not rember anything after that.  I believe I have two implants [pending on x-rays]. ((NUFORC Note:  We spoke via telephone with the witness, and he seemed to us to be quite sincere, in his recounting of the incident.  We encouraged him to document the possible presence of implants in his arm, and we will proceed with investigating the case, if implants are documented by medical examination.  PD)) ((NUFORC Note:  Source of report indicates that the date is approximate.  PD))

records.summary: Orange sphere disappears and reappears in the sky; seen in San Diego.
records.story: Orange sphere disappears and reappears in the sky; seen in San Diego. So, I was driving home this evening, and as I was pulling into the alley where I park, I could clearly see an orange light in the sky.  It was nighttime already, clear and the object was very easy to see.  It seemed stationary for the most part, until I parked and took out my camera to film.   At this point the object began to move from a northern direction towards the west rather slowly and horizontal.  I begin filming but could tell the image was hazy on my phone and did not resemble what I was actually seeing.   I heard people talking outside, so I just stopped filming and just looked at this object.  I'll try my best to describe.  It was an orange sphere and had an orange glow.  There seemed to be like darker orange lines In the center that made either a diamond or triangle shape.  It seemed as though something was in the center.  So, as the object moved, I'm questioning what it is, etc., and it begins to fade away.  It completely fades and then becomes visible again.  It was really odd.   It continues to move and does the same thing again (fades out/in) after a couple hundred feet of movement.  By this time it flew in front my apartment and I couldnt see it.  I walked south out of my alley to see if it were there and it was.  It flew at a slow rate towards the west and that was it.

records.summary: Soledad Mtn., looking W, observed 3 orange lights form a triangle over Pacific.  1 disappeared; another appeared.  ((anonymous report))
records.story: On Soledad Mountain, looking west, observed 3 orange lights form a triangle over Pacific.  One disappeared and another appeared then eventually appeared to turn off.  Not approaching jet traffic.   I am a pilot. ((NUFORC Note:  Source of the report elects to remain totally anonymous; provides no contact information.  PD))

records.summary: Circular, bright obj in the S sky; every 20 or 30 mins it would move further N, before disappearing.  ((NUFORC Note:  Venus??  PD))
records.story: Circular, bright object appeared in the south sky; every 20 or 30 mins it would move further north, before finally disappearing about 20:50pm. There seemed to be increased helicopter and airplane activity; one airplane looked like it flew pretty close to the object, before the plane's lights turned off and the object moved its position slightly before continuing to hover. Zooming in with a camera showed a ball of white light that was glowing, but that showed multicolor flickers, like when you put television on the wrong channel and see snow, except this snow was all the colors of the rainbow, flickering and mixing on a greyish white background. ((NUFORC Note:  We suspect a possible sighting of Venus.  Source remains anonymous.  PD)) ((NUFORC Note:  Witness elects to remain totally anonymous; provides no contact information.  PD))

records.summary: Fireball moving south to north in western sky lasting about 15 minutes, faded from sight in the distance.
records.story: Fireball moving south to north in western sky lasting about 15 minutes, faded from sight in the distance. At first I thought the fireball might be a meteor or an aircraft on fire.  It moved slowly south to north across the western sky.   When I first saw the fireball several small fireballs dropped and burned out as they fell.  This led me to believe it may be an aircraft that was burning, it dropped one last small fireball that burned-out, then it continued north across the sky moving at a pace similar to a plane in the distance, until it faded from sight. ((NUFORC Note:  Witness elects to remain totally anonymous; provides no contact information.  PD))

records.summary: Was standing on top of Sunset Cliffs overlooking the Pacific ocean.  I noticed a dim red light around near where the horizon should hav
records.story: Was standing on top of Sunset Cliffs, overlooking the Pacific ocean.  I noticed a dim red light around near where the horizon should have been sitting fairly still.  It then began to brighten and move around in an irregular pattern, almost like looking at the random flight path of a fly.   I ask my girlfriend if she is seeing the same thing I am and she confirms I am not seeing things.  We then spent the next 10 or so minutes watching this object brighten and dim while moving back and forth, gaining and losing altitude erratically.  The object was out over the pitch black ocean so I could not actually see the horizon so I could not determine how far away the object was.  There was no sound associated with the object.  I figure if the object was as close as two miles, its movements probably covered 0-1500ft in altitude and back and forth across the horizon a minimum of 3 miles.  It dimmed out once about 4 minutes in and appeared to be gone but came back about 3! 0 seconds after.  After it disappeared the second time I did not see it return and we left the location.

records.summary: Angel, protector.
records.story: angel, protector A white entity object appeared to me, prior to my work, in a parking lot around 5:45 am. The entity appeared out of nowhere and then flew like a bug and disappeared.  I took photos of the sun after the incident, 2 hours later, and captured a orb with purple colors.   I have not seen this type of close encounter since the 1980's. I have photos of the 9 am photo shoot. ((NUFORC Note:  Witness elects to remain totally anonymous; provides no contact information.  PD))

records.summary: Rectangle four white lights two red flashing lights moving slowly big large err with caution - uncertain
records.story: Rectangle four white lights two red flashing lights moving slowly big large err with caution - uncertain Have seen 4 UFOs in my lifetime.  One was iffy.  Could have been shadow play.  This one confusing, too.  Illusion?  Wish my boyfriend would have let me stop the car to look.  Will explain.   Appeared to be a rectangle.  Large like a popular grocery store.  Four white lights, each corner.  Two flashing red lights-like you see on airplanes-side by side on the "back end."  "Back-end" as in relation to the direction of motion.  Floating.  No regard for gravity. Angles staying in the same formation as the craft moves alongside the roadway.  As in towards and then away from my perspective.   If this was not an unidentified aircraft, then it could have been multiple aircraft flying in formation, far away, giving the appearance of forming a solid shape.  But the red lights confuse that possibility.  Also, live near an Airforce base.  Could have been a giant helicopter.  But still frustrating to work out.  Windows rolled up.  No radio, but no sound!!, still.  Even if! far away, would have heard the jets.  If close, would have heard propellers.....wish I could have pulled over.  Silly train to catch.......

records.story: firework like ship fell down then came up again only to down about 3 circles before disappearing (seen by 7 people). i was sitting in a friends backyard roasting s'mores with them and my family.  their was 7 of us including me.  we were sitting their for about 1hr to an 1 and a half talk about random things like school when i saw something from the corner of my eye.  i saw this round ball of fire falling down from the sky so i pointed it out to the others.   at first we thought it was an asteroid or a meteor because it just fell behind some houses about 1/2 a mile out.  but them it flew up and at an angle back into the sky and started to do circles in the sky then it just disappeared.   it got really quiet between the 7 of us like 'did that really just happen to us?'.  we kind of just left it unspoken about of the rest of the night. The ship looked like a firework that was falling at first but it had a tail following it. when it was doing circlers in the sky the tail did this weird tail flick kind of like a cat does when it's scared. it then just disappeared in a blink of an eye. records.story: At 11:45am, atop Mt Soledad, a group of 10 small silvery orbs were observed by myself and a contractor. to the East up at an elevation of 45 degrees above the horizon.  All 10 appeared to be connected, as if there was a tether, because the distances and directions from each other didn't vary although a small perceive drift was noted of the entire group.  It almost appeared as though these were small silver balloons connect by string.  They were loosely arranged in a line, but poorly so.   I watched for three minutes and had to enter a building for work and upon return 1 minute later they were nowhere to be found.  That's where the silvery-chrome balloon theory fell apart.  Amazing. records.story: Sitting in backyard with friend, looked up and saw metal orb.  It was like pin prick size in the sky.  Looked like it changed shape from sphere to elliptical.  Metal material, kept reflecting the sun, it was a clear day, no clouds.   At one point it looked to have blown out some smoke/light around it.  It headed east after about 15-20 minutes.  Looked back up five minutes later to see another sphere floating above, this one white and not reflective.  The metal one came back and they hovered together for about 15 minutes.  I glanced away and they were gone.

records.summary: Disk-surrounded with red/blue lights  doing amazing acrobatic maneuvers in night sky.
records.story: Disk-surrounded with red/blue lights  doing amazing acrobatic maneuvers in night sky. When I went out tonight to collect my mail, I witnessed a disk/flat shaped craft surrounded with bright/deep blue lights, and also red lights.  They appeared to be 1/2 and 1/2.   The object/craft was below the very high cloud cover and was in the West sky. As I watched it, it darted at a rapid speed, shooting back/forth, up/down.   A neighbor came outdoors to take her trash out, and I pointed to the craft, telling her what I had observed.  She looked up at it, stating she knew, as she had been watching it from her apartment balcony but didn't know what it was.   As we both stood watching it do racing/darting acrobatics, it suddenly shot straight up...then raced at a very high rate of speed to the North, out of sight.  The speed and ability to maneuver as it did made it impossible for it to have been any typical aircraft.  We heard no noise.

records.summary: I saw a green light as I was looking N.  At first I thought it was a plane, but not normal color.  ((anonymous report))
records.story: As I walked out my front door, I saw a green light as I was looking north. At first I thought it was a plane but not normal color. I looked away, as I walked to my car, then looked back at the light about 10 seconds later.  I saw that it had moved closer to me towards the south.  This suprised me since it seemed to have moved quite a distance in the span of 10 seconds. As I was looking at it it dropped straight down and then at a right angle at about 60 degrees and then out of sight behind the hills to the north. The duration of the movement was less than one second. I don't know the distance, but I would say at least 10 miles away from my position.  What ever it was it moved impossibly fast and turned at a sharp angle. The weather was clear with no clouds and a beautiful stary night. ((NUFORC Note:  Source of the report elects to remain anonymous; provides no contact information.  PD))

records.summary: Very small round object at first stationary then moved to new position, then disappeared as I watched it against a bright blue sky.
records.story: Very small round object at first stationary then moved to new position, then disappeared as I watched it against a bright blue sky. I sighted an unidentified moving object from the shore of Ocean Beach San Diego California at about 2 pm October 27.  Duration of sighting was less than 10 minutes. On this day the weather was very hot and dry as Santa Ana weather gave way to clear unlimited visibility and a cloudless bright blue sky.  I was laid on my back on the sandy beach so naturally I was looking skyward.  My feet were pointed straight to the surf so my body was aligned northwesterly looking out to sea.  The 2 pm sun was about 40 degrees to my left. As I watched an airliner pass by at mid altitude (10,000 feet) I noticed it pass by a small white spot in the sky.  The spot was roundish, stationary, and had the washed out white color the moon has on a sunny day.  This lead me to think I was looking at Venus or some other celestial object though I was skeptical as I have never seen any celestial object in the bright day sky other than the moon. For the next several minutes I stared at the spot for a short while and then look away for a minute and look back up again still puzzled at what I was looking at.  Each time I looked back up relocating it took a few moments as the small spot was difficult to see against the bright blue sky so I figured I should point straight at it so I could better relocate it the next time I looked away.  I pointed about 20 degrees to my right and about 20 degrees forward (from my laying down position). I then looked away for a short while and looked back up to relocated the spot but I did not see it. I pointed my finger in the direction I had just pointed a moment ago but the spot was gone.  Now I became very curious. I scanned the sky for a few seconds and I located the spot.  The spot was stationary but was then about 15 degrees to my left. Now my attention was peaked. Now I could rule out Venus or any other celestial object.  I stared intently at the spot for about 10 or 15 seconds when suddenly it appeared to move very slightly.  Slight movement was hard to tell against a bright blue background, so I extended my left hand and finger to try and gauge movement.  In the next few seconds I confirmed the spot was moving slightly, grew in brightness, then dim and vanish.  End of story. As the observer, I want to note that I am an adult with fine far vision (no glasses).  I had sunglasses on and viewed the object with and without my sun glasses.  I was not under the influence of any drug, alcohol, or medication.

records.summary: White dot "craft" appears to fly from left to right after missile passes.  ((NUFORC Note:  Possible second stage rocket?  PD))
records.story: White dot "Craft" appears to fly from left to right after missile passes. On December 22, 2017.  My family and I had just landed in San Diego, California, for Christmas with my grandmother.  After landing at about 5:30 pm PST, we started driving north towards La Jolla and saw what looked like a plane’s smoke trail.  The smoke started expanding and had a luminescent glow to it.  That’s where two lights sources that appeared to be parts of the rocket.  But at about 1 minute and 52 seconds of the video  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0UaZFDmLbLE   two light anomalies occurred.  The first is a quick light that appears on the left side of the screen and the second is a bright light that travels from the left of the screen, first decelerating and then quickly accelerating and disappearing off the right hand of the screen.  Both my brother and I saw the light anomaly and you can hear our reaction upon seeing it.  The cars window, from which we were filming, was down.  This bright light went at a speed that cannot be seen on Earth.  This appearance is unexplainable and has left many people speechless and with doubts about what they saw. ((NUFORC Note:  Possible second stage rocket?  PD))

records.story: I was on watch on the fantail on a uss warship while import in.  I looked up and seen three Green objects just hovering.  I started watching as it was my job.  They started to move to the right slowly and then stop.  Then they started to move again to the right.  As I am watching them move to the right they just took off straight up into the stars, then into the blackness of space.  I could not believe what I was seeing.  I knew there were no aircraft on earth that can move that fast.  Just like Star Trek Warp speed.  I just got into Navy and didn't want them to think I was crazy.  I didn't tell anyone until a few years later.  It's kind of messed up to see!!  Not supposed to see that stuff. records.summary: Orb over San Diego 10 Sep 2014.
records.story: Orb over San Diego 10 Sep 2014. I pulled into my driveway at around 6:30 p.m. on 10 Sep 2014.  I saw an object just to the right of my home and seemed to be hovering slightly above and behind my next door neighbor's home.  The object reflected the late afternoon orange glow. The sky was clear that evening.  At first I thought it may be a globe commonly seen hanging on power lines, but then realized there were no power lines in that area.  I could see no means of flight and there was absolutely no sound coming from the object.  I thought it was about 500 ft above the ground and I could see some details.  It appeared to be a small object about 4-6 ft in diameter.  The object appeared to gently sway as if impacted by a breeze, of which there was very little.  It eventually drifted away to the Southwest and out of sight. I went inside and got my camera and took almost 3 dz photos.  Also during the observation, I picked up my video camera and took about 12 min of video of the object toward the end of my sighting.  I observed the object for about 45 min in total (according to the time and date stamps on my photos).  I had to move my position to a different part of my backyard in order to continue to track the object as it drifted away. Finally it became too dark to track.  Also I forgot to take my video camera out of auto focus, so as it got darker and the leaves of the trees moved, the object appears to go in and out of focus.  That was my error. The first 2-3 min were observed without equipment.  Then I secured my camera(s) for the remainder of the time.  When I put the photos on my computer I could see more detail and noted 3 antenna or rods attached to the object.  There is an airport a few miles away and airplanes were flying in the background, but none came near or even close to the object.

records.summary: 4 lights moving quickly into a line, then disappearing one at a time.
records.story: 4 lights moving quickly into a line, then disappearing one at a time 4 bright white lights in sky  Seemed to be over Black Mountain, Rancho Penasquitos  One light zoomed into place, then stayed still, a second light zoomed across it then stayed still, right beside the first.  A third light did the same, and then a fourth.  After they were all lined up in a row, the lights quickly went out, one after another, starting with the first. They didn’t seem to come from anywhere.  We didn’t see them flying from a distance to land in this space.  It was like they appeared, moved into place, and then disappeared just as quickly. Two moms taking our two teenage daughters to a concert.  Both moms and one daughter saw the lights.

records.summary: Cigar-Shaped UFO, sited off the San Diego Coastline.
records.story: Cigar-Shaped UFO, sited off the San Diego Coastline. On the evening of October 26th, 2017, I witnessed and filmed a cigar-shaped UFO from my balcony.  I was able to take two videos of it before it disappeared behind some trees. I went out to my balcony to look at the sunset, which I do every evening, and I noticed a cigar shaped (glowing bright white) object, hovering in a vertical position.  It caught my eye because it was so bright.  There wasn’t a cloud in the sky, so it was easy to see. When I started to focus on the object, it rotated to a 2 o’clock position, and then started to descend in a slow, deliberate manner.  As it descended, it rotated to a horizontal position, as it was moving south.  It descended to a few hundred feet off the ground, and then continued to move in a somewhat straight line, until it disappeared behind some trees in the distance. I live in San Diego, CA, approximately 3 miles from the ocean.  The object looked to be a few miles off the coast.  Also, as it was moving south, a commercial airliner flew in front of it (on video).  It gives a good perspective of how large it was.  Even though the object was a few miles west of the airplane, it seemed to be as large, or bigger than the plane.

records.summary: U-shaped object with 5 lights.
records.story: U shaped object with 5 lights. I was outside this morning and noticed a bright object in the sky.  The sky was clear and there were no other objects in the blue sky except a large view of the moon off to the west. I was looking almost overhead when I saw the object and what appeared to be a bright light coming from it.  I thought it might be a reflection from the sun.  I got my binoculars but the image was still not very clear, but I could see the basic shape and that it had 5 lights - not reflections.  I set up my camera and tripod to catch the object as it was slowly moving away, now at about a 45 degree angle.  I got 5 quick photos before the object was too far away to focus.  It drifted off to the southwest.  No sounds or movement/change in the lights on the object.

records.summary: Taking my dog out I have a great view of the Southern skies of San Diego. My wife, roommate and myself noticed 4-5 reddish fireballs in
records.story: Taking my dog out, I have a great view of the Southern skies of San Diego.  My wife, roommate, and myself noticed 4-5 reddish fireballs in the southwest skies of San Diego.  It looked like it was just a little off the coast.   The fireballs were in a triangle formation and they were not moving.  We watched for about 10 minutes and they eventually disappeared...like they just burnt out and were gone.  I saw the exact same thing 1 year before.

records.summary: Cluster of 5 big yellow lights hovering over the horizon
records.story: Cluster of 5 big yellow lights hovering over the horizon 5 yellow lights clustered together hovering over the horizon in the southwest region of San Diego, seen from a hilly neighborhood in Spring Valley that overlooks east county, Tijuana, and the Downtown skyline.  1 light was a bit lower and separate from the other 4.   They were nothing like anything I've seen, very bright yellow, 5 times the size of an average star, and they were unmistakeably still, not moving at all.  They were constantly flickering, but not completely on and off.  Similar to a candle flicker.   I waited for them to fall or  move but they stayed still so I called my mom brother and sister to come see and we watched them stay still for about a whole minute.   Then I went to get my phone and captured the last seconds before they disappeared, one by one.  The one that was separated from the four and lower disappeared first.  It just started to dim until it was gone.   Then the other 4 followed.  They disappeared while in place.  We heard my neighbor say loudly, "they're gone" so we know at least one other person witnessed them, totaling at least 5 witnesses

records.summary: Silent low-flying light flying overhead in San Diego Tuesday January 23, 2018
records.story: silent low-flying light flying overhead in San Diego Tuesday January 23, 2018 At 6:36pm on Tuesday 23 January 2018 I was looking up at the stars here in San Diego.  It was a clear night.  A single bright light, larger than any of the stars, was moving from the Southwest to the Northeast.  There were no blinking anti-collision lights.  There was no sound coming from it that I could hear; even though it seemed to be flying very low.  It came almost directly over me.   As it passed over me, I was standing on the sidewalk in front of a 2-story building.  I moved a little into the street to see it continuing towards the Northeast and then it completely disappeared in about 2 seconds.  It slowing faded out.  I continued to look for another minute, but it never reappeared.  A police helicopter happened to be flying from the east towards me about 20 seconds later.  I mention that only because the helicopter appeared just a little lower than the earlier light by comparison.

records.summary: Bright Object Behaving Strangely.
records.story: Bright Object Behaving Strangely. I was speaking with a family member on the phone and walked over to my glass patio door to look outside.  A bright object in the sky at about the 11:00 position and to the west caught my attention.  That would put it over the Pacific Ocean.  It was very bright, but was not shimmering like a star.  I’ve seen Venus hundreds of times and this was probably 2 times the size of Venus.  It was roughly diamond shaped (with no defined edges) and had an orange-ish tinge.  It was also much too low to be a star as I could make out the thin, broken layer of high clouds behind it.  So, my first thought was that it was a helicopter, especially given that there is occasionally police helicopter activity in the area and the altitude seemed about right.   I continued to watch it, expecting that the object would turn/move soon and I would see its aviation lights, but it just remained in the same position for about 15 minutes.  Then I thought I saw it wavering sideways just a bit, so I lined up the edge of a palm tree with the object, and sure enough, it had a very subtle back-and-forth horizontal motion to it.  I never saw any aviation lights.  I still assumed it was probably a helicopter, and I was still having a conversation on the phone, so I didn’t open the door to see if I could hear a faint rotor sound in the distance.  Actually with all of the other city noise (i.e., nearby freeway, local traffic) and with the distance, listening for a sound from the object would have given an inconclusive result.   I continued to watch it and was about to lose interest, when things got even stranger.  The object faded out in place for a brief moment and then grew bright again, matching its original size and intensity.  It was like a light bulb on a dimmer switch and you quickly turn down the voltage to the point where the bulb goes out and then you increase the power until the bulb is at full brightness again.   At first I thought perhaps the effect was caused by clouds p! assing in front of the object, but again the clouds were much higher a nd quite thin.  After a few more minutes, the object started becoming smaller and smaller, until it was a tiny spec in the distance.  This had a very different visual look than the dimming.  This time it appeared more like the object flew away at a level trajectory (further out over the ocean) and then stopped.  This changed took only a matter of seconds.   I watched it in the distance for a minute or so and thought there was nothing more to see, so I looked away for another minute or two.  When I looked up at the sky again, the object was back, in the exact location described at the beginning of this report and with the same shape and brightness.   After a few more minutes, it did the same maneuver again – appearing to move away very rapidly at a horizontal/level trajectory with the object becoming a tiny spec in the distance at the same location as before, except this time it completely disappeared. About halfway into this event, I noticed what were obvious airplanes (aviation lights visible) slowly circling far away from the object while it was in its original/stationary position.  It seems that these airplanes had their approach to the San Diego airport interrupted.  I say that because once the object disappeared as described above, an unusually high volume of airplanes started flying through the original area where the object was.  These airplanes were clearly headed to the airport.  //End of Report//

records.summary: White object high over south end of USMC Mira Mar base(past Top Gun) heading South and West.
records.story: White object high over south end of USMC Mira Mar base(past Top Gun) heading South and West. Looking from ground level, south, a large white object moving south and then curving west over and away from the area of USMC aircraft base Mira Mar.  Compared to the sun, very small point of bright white, a bit of a cigar shape, moving slowly.  When a black helicopter, no markings, no numbers passed by at approx 1000 ft. moving ese approx 100 mph.  As I scanned the area I saw a jet fighter contrail, could be F-14, F18 or 22, as we have Naval aviation here as well as USMC.  This fighter was approaching the area of the Mira Mar base, fast, approx 1,200 mph or more towards the area of this object on a ese heading, approx 10,000 ft or higher, it would be 5 minutes, as the object curved to the west approaching the Pacific ocean, then disappeared from view.  Thanks for taking my call.

records.summary: I was outside between two one-story buildings, the ground lights illuminated from below the underside.  ((anonymous report))
records.story: I was outside in an open hallway, between two one story buildings, the ground lights illuminated from below street the underside of the single craft.  I saw it completely when it passed into view from first building and crossed out of view from the second building.  It was black, like the night sky above it.  It was possibly 200 hundred feet above me.  It was completely silent as it glided directly above my position, travelling probably 10-15 MPH.  25-35 feet long on each side.  Equally spaced dim yellow lights on side it propelled itself from. ((NUFORC Note:  Witness elects to remain totally anonymous; provides no contact information.  PD))

records.story: Saw 4 spheres floating at an altitude 10,000 ft.  A commercial aircraft with an ice contrail flew a good distance behind them. They were gone within 5 mins. They looked silver in color and shimmered.

records.summary: White circle ufos flying in formation over salton sea area
records.story: White circle ufos flying in formation over salton sea area I was on an American Airlines flight (438) from Phoenix to San Diego when I saw a group of white circles flying in a square formation below the plane. My flight was flying west approx 20k feet and the formation was flying East at a significantly lower altitude. I would say prob at 10k - 12k feet, maybe less. Hard to say exactly. There were three or four rows of white circles with 4-5 circles in each row flying together in a very tight formation. The rows were all equal in number and each craft was the same size. The last row was missing two from the formation. The white circles were not glowing, did not have any other color or any other distinct other surface, each one was the same with no difference in size or shape.  They looked like white frisbees and from my perspective in the plane, were about the size of a Certs peppermint candy. In comparison, houses on the ground looked to be lightly larger.  The objects cast a shadow on the ground as did my plane as the weather was completely cloudless and sunny. I sighted the formation and since we were flying in opposite directions my view from the plane was very short.

records.story: There were lights which appeared to be attached by a line/wire.  They were traveling at around the speed of a typical, commercial/private aircraft.  There was no noise and there was no visible craft pulling what looked to be stars/lights on some sort of invisible wiring system.  The lights were headed Southwest.
